author: fradamt
fradamt
content:
Another option would of course be to simplify the whole thing to have a single queue for exits and consolidations (always use `compute_exit_epoch_and_update_churn`, but with `3 * exit_balance // 2` when it is a consolidation, and completely remove `compute_consolidation_epoch_and_update_churn`). This is a bit weird because:
- the WS period would be determined by the worst case, i.e. the whole queue using consolidations, so we'd have max exit churn = X but the churn relevant for the WS period would be 1.5X
- no dedicated exit churn, so exits can get crowded by consolidations (which seems a lot worse than the contrary, because someone exiting might need the ETH back, versus someone consolidating is staying in the system and shouldn't have much of a reason to care when exactly the consolidation happens, as they are earning rewards throughout)
